column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=It does not seem necessary to enter here into the
#Text=theological meaning of each separate act of censing, all no
#Text=doubt are the result of the teaching of the Spirit of God ; but
#Text=there is one point of such great antiquity, and of such singular
#Text=pathos, that it should not be omitted.
#Text=Of course it will be
#Text=remembered how usually, almost universally, in the primitive
#Text=Church, the martyrs were buried under the Altar, and so it
#Text=came about that the Priest, while censing the Altar at the
#Text=South end, stooped down and censed the feet of the dear
#Text=servant of Christ, and then again his head, when he was cpme
#Text=to the North, and the whole body as he passed back from
#Text=North to South.
#Text=The bodies of the Saints are but rarely there
#Text=now, but the Church has continued her method of censing,
#Text=wrapping all, both quick and dead, in the all availing inter
#Text=cession of Her Great Head.
#Text=It is no part of our intention to claim a Scriptural authority,
#Text=or suggestion even, of every detail of the present method of
#Text=using Incense in the Christian Church.
#Text=We distinctly affirm
#Text=with St.
#Text=Thomas (vide loc. cit.) that its use does not rest upon
#Text=the authority of the Mosaic law, but upon that of the Christian
#Text=Church alone.
#Text=We are ready to admit with many of the
#Text=learned, among whom may be numbered Aquinas, De Vert,
#Text=and Scudamore (against others of equal learning), that the
#Text=desire of producing a sweet smell in a place which otherwise
#Text=would have been foul, may have had something to do with its
#Text=introduction into the Christian Church, as it undoubtedly had
#Text=something to do with its being ordered by Moses for use in
#Text=the Tabernacle made of skins.
#Text=We affirm, with Tertullian,
#Text=that we use Incense in a fashion different from the heathen, to
#Text=wit in a swinging censer, and not in a standing vessel, as the
#Text=Pagans did.
#Text=We are of opinion that the censing of persons
#Text=and things is the only method of using Incense which is
#Text=distinctly Christian ; and finally we deny that it is possible to
#Text=find in this custom of the Church (be its antiquity what it may)
#Text=any superstition, or the setting forth of any doctrine other than
#Text=the perfect sufficiency of the Sacrifice of Calvary, and the need
#Text=of all being gathered in one through the intercession of the
#Text=Eternal Victim, which for a sweet savour rises before the
#Text=Mercy Seat on High.
